title: If you became edible and had no food for 20 days except yourself, would you eat yourself? If so, why? - Quora

response.answer_text: In fairness, we are edible. We supposedly taste like Pork. But, in this weird hypothetical instance, no. I wouldn’t. I would try to forage something to eat, and failing that (and having water) I’d just live off my reserves. I’ve got a decent amount of fat on my body, and I know that I could easily last for 30 days with only water. I’d obviously be unhealthy, and unhappy about it, but why would I eat part of my body as food, when the lasting damage, trauma, and potential infection would clearly affect me for the rest of my life, when my body has adaptations to survive without food for a long time? Technically, my body would start to eat itself, without my mouth having anything to do with it.

Technically, I am edible right now (though I wouldn’t cooperate!) People in survival situations - for example, stranded in mountains after plane crashes - have sometimes resorted to eating the passengers who didn’t survive the crash. However, I wouldn’t try to survive by eating myself. Left to itself, a starving body will draw on its own fat and muscle to stay alive. That would be a much safer tactic than cutting or gnawing pieces of myself off and swallowing them; first, it avoids the immediate dangers of blood loss and infection; second, if I’m rescued or find regular food somehow, a half-starved body will rebuild itself. A body that has had chunks of muscle removed can’t grow them back.
